contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. The second intensifies the first. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: disobey the truth but obey unrighteousness

contextId.information: These two phrases have similar meanings. The first phrase, "he is a Jew who is one inwardly," explains the second phrase, "circumcision is that of the heart." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that God will avenge his people. AT: "I will certainly avenge you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: Vengeance belongs to me; I will repay
